entries.meaning: One who vamps; one who creates or repairs by piecing old things together; a cobbler.
examples: Cibber, a vamper of other men’s plays, has borrowed from it his favourite Nonjuror, and applied it to the purposes of a political party.

verbs.description: vamper (third-person singular simple present vampers, present participle vampering, simple past and past participle vampered)

entries.meaning: (UK, Scotland, dialect) To swagger; to make an ostentatious show.
